basics.name: Sulthan Zahran Ma'ruf
basics.label: Instrumentation Physicist, Software Engineer, Operation Research Enthusiast
basics.summary: Experienced instrumentation and software engineer specializing in developing manufacturing execution systems, data acquisition solutions, and real-time data analysis applications.

work.summary: Developed and maintained the General Manufacturing Execution System (GMES) and real-time dispatch (RTD) for LG ENSOL's battery factory.
highlights: Implemented code updates to GMES and RTD based on client requirements and performed rigorous testing of modifications made by others.
Participated in code reviews and mentored junior developers, promoting best practices in WPF development.

work.summary: Implemented a data acquisition system for temperature and flow monitoring in the laboratory.
highlights: Explored multiple approaches for data acquisition systems, including DAQ, PLC, and Arduino.
Designed circuits using Arduino ADC and thermocouple amplifiers.
Coded the Arduino for the designed circuits and developed a PyQt GUI for interaction.

work.summary: Engineered a Real-time Data Analyzer for advanced spectroscopic analysis using App Designer.
highlights: Developed a MATLAB-based GUI for spectroscopic data analysis with dynamic spectrometer settings.
Integrated advanced peak detection, fitting for precise analysis, and band gap estimation via Tauc plots.

work.summary: Programmed and designed HMI for cream spreader machines.
highlights: Developed PLC programs and designed HMIs to optimize machine performance.
Collaborated with the engineering team to troubleshoot and enhance machine functionalities.

volunteer.summary: Led programming initiatives for robotics projects within the club.
highlights: Programmed the Line Follower Robot to achieve optimal performance in competitions.
Managed programming and electrical tasks for the Digital Twins-based Robot.
Integrated cameras with the arena to enable the Digital Twins Arena feature.

education.summary: Bachelor of Science in Instrumentation Physics with a thesis on developing an Arduino-Based Automated Probe System for data acquisition.

awards.title: 4th Place - Hero HPL Challenge
awards.awarder: IndySCC 22 held by ACM/IEEE Supercomputing Conference, Dallas (US)
awards.summary: Achieved 4th place in the Hero HPL Challenge, demonstrating expertise in distributed and parallel scientific computing.
